trans-unit.source: Retrieves the callback mask for the control

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves the callback mask for the control

target.mrk: Retrieves the callback mask for the control

trans-unit.source: Returns an Value of the callback mask. The bits of the mask indicate the item states or images for which the application stores the current state data. This value can be any combination of the following:

seg-source.mrk: Returns an Value of the callback mask.
The bits of the mask indicate the item states or images for which the application stores the current state data.
This value can be any combination of the following:

target.mrk: Returns an Value of the callback mask.
The bits of the mask indicate the item states or images for which the application stores the current state data.
This value can be any combination of the following:

trans-unit.source: 1 - The item is marked for a cut-and-paste operation

seg-source.mrk: 1 - The item is marked for a cut-and-paste operation

target.mrk: 1 - The item is marked for a cut-and-paste operation

trans-unit.source: 2 - The item is highlighted as a drag-and-drop target

seg-source.mrk: 2 - The item is highlighted as a drag-and-drop target

target.mrk: 2 - The item is highlighted as a drag-and-drop target

trans-unit.source: 16 - The application stores the image list index of the current overlay image

seg-source.mrk: 16 - The application stores the image list index of the current overlay image

target.mrk: 16 - The application stores the image list index of the current overlay image

trans-unit.source: 32 - The application stores the image list index of the current state image

seg-source.mrk: 32 - The application stores the image list index of the current state image

target.mrk: 32 - The application stores the image list index of the current state image

trans-unit.source: The callback mask is a set of bit flags that specify the item states for which the application, rather than the control, stores the current data.

seg-source.mrk: The callback mask is a set of bit flags that specify the item states for which the application, rather than the control, stores the current data.

target.mrk: The callback mask is a set of bit flags that specify the item states for which the application, rather than the control, stores the current data.

trans-unit.source: The callback mask applies to all of the control's items, unlike the callback item designation, which applies to a specific item.

seg-source.mrk: The callback mask applies to all of the control's items, unlike the callback item designation, which applies to a specific item.

target.mrk: The callback mask applies to all of the control's items, unlike the callback item designation, which applies to a specific item.

trans-unit.source: The callback mask is zero by default, meaning that the control stores all item state information.

seg-source.mrk: The callback mask is zero by default, meaning that the control stores all item state information.

target.mrk: The callback mask is zero by default, meaning that the control stores all item state information.

trans-unit.source: Add items with callback for item text

target.mrk: Add items with callback for item text
